data.title: Last chance to buy tickets for Palace v West Ham in Tampa!
data.text:
Following a successful tour of Chicago and Detroit in 2023, Palace – collaborating with Elite Promotions Group – are once again connecting with their sizeable American fanbase.

The Eagles have now left Annapolis following a successful stay and a 3-1 win over Wolverhampton Wanderers at the Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium.

We have now travelled to Tampa, Florida, where we will face London rivals West Ham United on Saturday, 3rd August (kick-off 19:00 EDT local time / 00:00 BST Sunday UK time) at the Raymond James Stadium, which seats around 69,000 and is home to NFL outfit Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

Please note the Crystal Palace Fan Sections: 147, 148, 149

With Wolves having defeated West Ham by a scoreline of 3-1 earlier in the week, the inaugural Stateside Cup trophy will be awarded to the best-performing team across the three fixtures.

Palace’s recent Premier League meetings with Wolves and West Ham have produced plenty of goals and entertainment – the Eagles defeated both teams at Selhurst Park earlier this season, 3-2 and 5-2 respectively.

Chairman Steve Parish said: "After such a brilliant tour last year, we are delighted to be returning to the United States once again this summer.

“As a club, we are always hugely appreciative of the support that we receive over in the US, and we hope our growing fanbase will enjoy the chance to join us in Annapolis and Tampa for two exciting matches against Premier League opposition.

“I know our US-based supporters will give Oliver and his team a warm welcome as they step up preparations for the 2024/25 season.”

Palace have developed a special relationship with their American fanbase and this continues to grow with the popularity of the game, with the United States due to co-host the 2026 FIFA World Cup finals alongside Canada and Mexico.

On top of six previous pre-season tours Stateside, Palace have attended the last two Premier League Mornings Live! Events in Nashville, Tennessee, and Orlando, Florida, where the club was represented by the American Eagle Foundation’s 34-year old American Bald Eagle ‘Challenger’.

US Men’s National Team player Chris Richards recently scored his first goal for the club, after moving to south London in the summer of 2022, following in the footsteps of Gregg Berhalter, who became the first Palace player to feature at a World Cup finals when he represented the USA in South Korea and Japan in 2002.

Plus, American hit TV show Ted Lasso was filmed at Selhurst Park, which has been seen in televisions across the country as the home ground of the fictional side AFC Richmond.

Match Details

Crystal Palace v Wolverhampton Wanderers

Wednesday, 31st July

20:00 EDT local time / 01:00 BST Thursday UK time

Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium, Maryland

Crystal Palace Fan Sections: 1, 2, 101, 102

Tickets on sale here.

Crystal Palace v West Ham United

Saturday, 3rd August

19:00 EDT local time / 00:00 BST Sunday UK time

Raymond James Stadium, Tampa

Crystal Palace Fans Sections: 147, 148, 149

Tickets on sale here.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

What will happen on tour?

Crystal Palace Men's first-team squad will play matches against fellow English Premier League teams:

Wolverhampton Wanderers on Wednesday, 31st July (kick-off 20:00 EDT local time / 01:00 BST Thursday UK time) at the Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium in Annapolis, Maryland.

West Ham United on Saturday, 3rd August (kick-off 19:00 EDT local time / 00:00 BST Sunday UK time) at the Raymond James Stadium in Tampa, Florida.

As well as playing these fixtures, the club will host supporter get-togethers, events and open training sessions (details TBC), and the team's players and staff will immerse themselves in both cities and communities.

How do I buy tickets?

For Palace v Wolves, tickets are on sale here.

For Palace v West Ham, tickets are on sale here.

All tickets will be digital and sent to supporters by email to download onto mobile devices.

Will there be a designated area in both stadiums for Palace fans?

Yes.

For Palace v Wolves, our fan sections are: 1, 2, 101, 102

Please note, however, that for this fixture, all tickets for all sections will be available for sale (Upper and Lower Bowl) from the start of Pre-Sale and into General public sale.

For Palace v West Ham, our fan sections are: 147, 148, 149

These can also be found on each stadium map as you progress through the purchase process.

Please note that only the lower bowl sections of the stadium will be on sale for this match to begin with.

How much do tickets cost?

Ticket prices start from $35 each for both matches.

Are group bookings available?

For groups of ten or more at Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium (Palace v Wolves), please contact info@gotticketing.com.

For groups of ten or more at Raymond James Stadium (Palace v West Ham), please click here.

Are accessible seats available?

For accessible seating at Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium (Palace v Wolves), please contact info@gotticketing.com.

For accessible seating at Raymond James Stadium (Palace v West Ham), please click here.

Is premium seating available?

Supporters can purchase a private suite in both stadiums.

To purchase a suite at Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium (Palace v Wolves), please contact info@gotticketing.com.

To purchase a suite at Raymond James Stadium (Palace v West Ham), please click here.

Is parking available?

For parking information at Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium (Palace v Wolves), please click here.

For parking information at Raymond James Stadium (Palace v West Ham), please click here.

Will the matches be streamed live?

Broadcast information will be confirmed in due course.
